chapter.title: Deploying with the &cephadm; Module
chapter.para: The process of deploying a &ceph; cluster by using the &cephadm; module has the following stages:

listitem.para: Installation of the underlying operating system—&cephos;—on all cluster nodes.
Deployment of the &salt; infrastructure over all cluster nodes so that you can orchestrate them effectively.
Configuration of the &adm;—a place from which you will deploy and administer the cluster.
Deployment of &ceph; services that will help you store, monitor, and access data.

step.para: Install and register &cephos; on each cluster node. Include the following modules:
Find more details on how to install &cephos; in .
Install the &productname; &productnumber; extension on each cluster node.

tip.title: Install &productname; &productnumber; Together with &cephos;
tip.para: You can either install the &productname; &productnumber; extension separately after you have installed &cephos;, or you can add it during the &cephos; installation procedure.

step.para: Find more details on how to install extensions in .

Configure network settings including proper DNS name resolution on each node. For more information on configuring a network, see
For more information on configuring a DNS server, see .

Provide reliable time sources for cluster nodes. Select one or more time servers or pools, and synchronize the cluster nodes' local time against them. Verify that the time synchronization service is enabled on each system start-up.
Find more information on setting up time synchronization in .

listitem.para: &sminion;s are the nodes controlled by a dedicated node called &smaster;. &sminion;s have roles, for example &osd;, &mon;, &mgr;, &rgw;, &igw;, or &ganesha;.

A &smaster; runs its own &sminion;. It is required for running privileged tasks—for example creating, authorizing, and copying keys to minions—so that remote minions never need to run privileged tasks.

tip.title: Sharing Multiple Roles per Server
tip.para: You will get the best performance from your &ceph; cluster when each role is deployed on a separate node. But real deployments sometimes require sharing one node for multiple roles. To avoid trouble with performance and the upgrade procedure, do not deploy the &osd;, &mds;, or &mon; role to the &adm;.

listitem.para: &sminion;s need to correctly resolve the &smaster;'s host name over the network. By default, they look for the salt host name, but you can specify any other network-reachable host name in the /etc/salt/minion file, see DEAD LINK.
